conclusion: Analyze the motion of the negatively charged particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle moves in a straight line between the plates.
The electric force is balanced by the magnetic force.
The electric field between the plates is uniform and directed horizontally.
Electric force on the particle is \( F_e = qE \).
Magnetic force on the particle is \( F_m = qvB \).
For the particle to move straight, \( qE = qvB \) implies \( E = vB \).
After exiting the electric field region, the particle enters the magnetic field region.
The particle moves in a circular path due to the magnetic field.
Radius of the circular path is \( r = \frac{mv}{qB} \).
The particle just fails to exit the magnetic field from side \( cd \).
The distance from the center of the circular path to side \( cd \) is \( L \).
The radius \( r \) must be equal to \( L \).
Substitute \( r \) into the radius formula: \( L = \frac{mv}{qB} \) implies \( v = \frac{qBL}{m} \).
The magnitude of the velocity of the particle when it is shot into point \( S \) is \( v = \frac{qBL}{m} \).
